_header: Now fresh flower to me that is so bright
Subjects: lovers, addresses to beloved; complaints, lovers’
_description: A poem addressed to his heartless mistress — thirteen quatrains (abab)

CamTCC599.First Lines:
[N]ow fresshe floure to me that ys so bryghtOf your louely
                    womanhode I pray yow of grace…
CamTCC599.Last Lines:
…ffor youre loue my deth ys dyghtMy soule to god standeth in
                    despeyre
CamTCC599.Note:
After concluding quatrain, ‘Lothe to offende’ in
                    scribe’s hand, f. 157v.
